721673f-a.text:
46 Monroe Street, south east corner of Market Street
showing P.S. 177.
Board of Education, N.Y.C.
Ne.. ~ 257E
721673f-a.folder: Monroe Street & Market Street, Manhattan, NY

721625f-a.text:
(1)
Market Street, south from but not including Monroe, to and including Cherry Streets. Also shon is Market Slip, (a continuation of Market Street, south of Cherry Street), east side, south from and including Cherry Street, to and including the East River. The Manhattan Bridge is shown in the background, extending out over the East River to the Williamsburg Section of the Borough of Kings.
(Brooklyn).
Larch 3, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, showing a closer view of No. 72 Market Street, adjoining the S.E. corner of Monroe Street. The building is the Hamilton House, an old settlement house now used by the Henry Street Nurses.
September 7, 1927.
P. L. Sperr.
721625f-a.folder: Market Street & Monroe Street, Manhattan, NY

721674f-a.text:
(1)
Monroe Street, at, adjoining and west of the N.W. corner of Market Street. Also shown is Market Street, west side, north from and including Monroe Street, to East Broadway. In the foreground appears a portion of the excavation for Knickerbocker Village.
March 6, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, from a slightly different angle.
March 6, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.

721669f-a.text:
Monroe Street, west from Market to Catherine Streets, showing prominently the north side. Buildings appearing on the left have been demolished and today (1937) Knickerbocker Village stands there; it being
the north side of same.
NEd6 ~375  30 S639  About 1925.
Ewing Calloway.
